title: Famous Couples in History
description: Test your knowledge of history's most famous romantic and powerful partnerships!

questions.question: Which Hollywood couple was known as 'America's Sweethearts' in the early days of film?
questions.explanation: Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford were the first celebrity supercouple, living in their famous mansion 'Pickfair' in Beverly Hills.

questions.question: Who was Cleopatra's famous Roman lover who followed her to Egypt?
questions.explanation: Mark Antony fell in love with Cleopatra VII, abandoning Rome. Their tragic story ended with both taking their own lives after defeat by Octavian.

questions.question: Which royal couple's 1981 wedding was watched by an estimated 750 million TV viewers?
questions.explanation: The wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer at St Paul's Cathedral was dubbed 'the wedding of the century.'

questions.question: Which couple starred together in 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?' and married twice?
questions.explanation: Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor were married twice (1964-1974, 1975-1976) and their turbulent romance captivated the world.

questions.question: John Adams and his wife Abigail are famous for their extensive collection of what?
questions.explanation: John and Abigail Adams exchanged over 1,100 letters that provide a remarkable window into their marriage and early American history.

questions.question: Which couple performed together at Woodstock in 1969 and later had a famous TV variety show?
questions.explanation: Johnny Cash and June Carter performed at Woodstock. They married in 1968 and remained together until June's death in 2003.

questions.question: Which famous couple's love letters, written during World War II, became bestselling books?
questions.explanation: Winston and Clementine Churchill exchanged over 1,700 letters during their 57-year marriage, later published as 'Speaking for Themselves.'

questions.question: Who did Jackie Kennedy marry after the assassination of President JFK?
questions.explanation: Jacqueline Kennedy married Greek shipping magnate Aristotle Onassis in 1968, becoming known as 'Jackie O.'

questions.question: Which Hollywood couple has been married since 1988 and starred together in 'Far and Away'?
questions.explanation: Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson married in 1988 and remain one of Hollywood's most enduring couples.

questions.question: Which power couple ruled Egypt together, with the wife serving as a co-regent?
questions.explanation: Pharaoh Akhenaten and Queen Nefertiti ruled together during the 14th century BC, revolutionizing Egyptian religion and art.

questions.question: Which couple's romance inspired the movie 'A Beautiful Mind'?
questions.explanation: John Nash, the Nobel Prize-winning mathematician, and his wife Alicia's story was portrayed in the 2001 film starring Russell Crowe.

questions.question: Which couple won Nobel Prizes together for their work on radioactivity?
questions.explanation: Pierre and Marie Curie shared the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics. Marie later won a second Nobel in Chemistry in 1911.

questions.question: Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz were TV's first couple to do what on screen?
questions.explanation: Lucy's real-life pregnancy was written into I Love Lucy in 1952-53, making it the first show to feature a pregnant woman — though they couldn't say the word 'pregnant.'

questions.question: Which English king gave up his throne 'for the woman I love'?
questions.explanation: Edward VIII abdicated in 1936 to marry American divorcée Wallis Simpson, as the Church of England opposed the marriage.

questions.question: Napoleon Bonaparte wrote passionate love letters to which wife?
questions.explanation: Napoleon's love letters to Josephine de Beauharnais are among history's most passionate. They married in 1796 but divorced in 1810.

questions.question: Which musical couple recorded 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough' together?
questions.explanation: Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell recorded this Motown classic in 1967. Though not a romantic couple, their musical chemistry was undeniable.

questions.question: Which couple founded a legendary Hollywood studio together in 1919 with Charlie Chaplin?
options: Louis B. Mayer & his wife Margaret
questions.explanation: Douglas Fairbanks, Mary Pickford, Charlie Chaplin, and D.W. Griffith founded United Artists in 1919 to control their own films.

questions.question: Paul Newman and Joanne Woodward were married for how many years?
questions.explanation: Paul Newman and Joanne Woodward were married for 50 years (1958-2008), one of Hollywood's most enduring marriages.

questions.question: Which First Lady was known for saying 'Just Say No' to drugs?
questions.explanation: Nancy Reagan launched the 'Just Say No' anti-drug campaign in the 1980s. She and Ronald Reagan were married for 52 years.

questions.question: Which legendary folk music couple performed at the 1963 March on Washington?
questions.explanation: Bob Dylan and Joan Baez performed at the March on Washington where Martin Luther King Jr. gave his 'I Have a Dream' speech. Their romantic and musical partnership defined the folk era.
